H0.text: What mythological beast has the head of a man, the body of a lion, and the tail and feet of a dragon. A Chimera

H1.text: What mythological beast has the head of a man, the body of a lion, and the tail and feet of a dragon. A Sphinx

H2.text: What mythological beast has the head of a man, the body of a lion, and the tail and feet of a dragon. A Griffin

H3.text: What mythological beast has the head of a man, the body of a lion, and the tail and feet of a dragon. A manticore

A4.text: Homer described the Chimera in the Iliad as having a lion's fore part, a goat in the midst, and a serpent in the hinder part.

A5.text: In Heraldry, the Chimera is shown to have the hindquarters of a dragon, not a human head.

A6.text: The griffin, griffon, or gryphon is a legendary creature with the body, tail, and back legs of a lion, and the head and wings of an eagle.
